hero.title: Know what runs before you switch
hero.subtitle: WinuxDB maps Windows app compatibility across Linux. Search, filter, and compare ratings so you can migrate with confidence.

Login.terms: By continuing, you agree to our <terms>Terms of Use</terms> and <privacy>Privacy Policy</privacy>.

Metadata.description: WinuxDB is the definitive Linux compatibility database for Windows applications. Search thousands of apps, check Wine and Proton ratings, and find the best Linux distro for your workflow.

DistroTaglines.ubuntu: Stable, polished, and backed by a massive community.
DistroTaglines.linux-mint: Comfortable, classic, and welcoming for Windows converts.
DistroTaglines.fedora: Fast, modern, and upstream-first with new features early.
DistroTaglines.popos: Ubuntu-based and productivity-focused, with strong hardware support.
DistroTaglines.arch: Minimal base, total control, rolling release.
DistroTaglines.endeavouros: Arch power with an easier installer and community focus.
DistroTaglines.bazzite: SteamOS-like gaming on Fedora Atomic, ready out of the box.
DistroTaglines.nobara: Fedora tuned for gaming, streaming, and creators.
DistroTaglines.zorin: Polished, Windows-like experience with friendly defaults.
DistroTaglines.pikaos: Ubuntu-based gaming distro tuned for low latency.
DistroTaglines.opensuse: The choice for sysadmins and developers with unique configuration tools.
DistroTaglines.nixos: Declarative, reproducible, and unbreakable system configuration.
DistroTaglines.manjaro: Accessible Arch-based distro with a focus on user-friendliness.

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: WinuxDB is a community-driven project dedicated to mapping Windows application compatibility on Linux. We value transparency and your privacy.

data.title: 1. Data Collection
data.content: WinuxDB collects minimal information to provide its services. When you create an account, we store your nickname, avatar (via social providers), and preferred language. For compatibility reports, we store the hardware profile you choose to share. We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties.

accounts.title: 2. User Accounts
accounts.content: We use social authentication (Google, GitHub, Discord) to simplify account creation. We only receive basic profile information required to identify your account and display your contributions.

storage.title: 3. Data Storage & Management
storage.content: Your hardware profiles and reviews are stored in our secure database. You can manage, update, or soft-delete your hardware profiles at any time. When a device is soft-deleted, it remains in our database to preserve historical review data but is no longer linked to your active profile.

cookies.title: 4. Local Storage & Preferences
cookies.content: We use your browser's local storage or minimal cookies solely to maintain your session and remember your language preference. This data is essential for the site to function correctly.

links.title: 5. External Links
links.content: Our database contains links to external websites (e.g. ProtonDB, Are We Anti-Cheat Yet?, GitHub). We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these third-party services.

Terms.title: Terms of Service
Terms.intro: By using WinuxDB, you agree to the following terms. This project is created by the community, for the community, and is intended for informational purposes only.

moderation.title: 1. Community Moderation
moderation.content: All users are required to follow our Community Guidelines. WinuxDB maintainers reserve the right to moderate content, hide reviews, and suspend or ban accounts that violate these guidelines, including those engaging in harassment, discrimination, or intentional misinformation.

noWarranty.title: 2. No Warranty
noWarranty.content: Information on WinuxDB is provided on an 'as-is' basis. Compatibility ratings are based on community reports and may not reflect your specific configuration. We do not guarantee that any application will run perfectly or at all.

liability.title: 3. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: WinuxDB, its contributors, and maintainers are not liable for any system instability, data loss, hardware damage, or financial loss resulting from the use of information found on this site. You use compatibility layers at your own risk.

affiliation.title: 4. No Affiliation
affiliation.content: WinuxDB is an independent community project. We are not affiliated with, endorsed by, or sponsored by Microsoft Corporation, WineHQ, CodeWeavers, Valve Corporation (Proton), ProtonDB, Are We Anti-Cheat Yet?, or any software author listed here.

About.title: About WinuxDB
About.subtitle: Bridging the gap between Windows and Linux

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: WinuxDB was born from a simple observation: the biggest hurdle for most users switching to Linux isn't the interface or the terminal—it's the fear of losing their essential applications. We aim to eliminate 'compatibility anxiety' by providing clear, community-verified data on what runs, what doesn't, and how to get the most out of Wine compatibility layers.

history.title: Community-First
history.content: Inspired by the success of ProtonDB for gaming, WinuxDB focuses on the productivity, creative, and utility apps that power our daily lives. We are not a corporate entity; we are a group of enthusiasts building the resource we wish we had when we first switched.

Contribute.title: Contribute to WinuxDB
Contribute.subtitle: Help us build the ultimate compatibility index
Contribute.intro: WinuxDB is a community-driven project. Every rating, report, and line of code helps the Linux community grow.

reporting.title: 1. Live Compatibility Reports
reporting.content: The fastest way to contribute is by reporting how apps run on your system. Sign in, create your hardware profile, and submit reviews directly on any app page. Your reports help us build a real-time database of what works.

issues.title: 2. Report Issues & Bugs
issues.content: Found a bug in the site or incorrect data? You can report it directly through our feedback form. We value your help in keeping WinuxDB clean and accurate.

code.title: 3. Code & Design
code.content: Our codebase is open-source and built with Next.js. We welcome Pull Requests for UI improvements, performance optimizations, and new features. Check our GitHub for 'good first issues'.

data.title: 4. Data Integrity
data.content: While live reports are the primary source, our foundation remains the community-curated apps database. Technical contributions to our data structure are always welcome via GitHub.

Guidelines.title: Community Guidelines
Guidelines.subtitle: Maintaining a safe and accurate compatibility database
Guidelines.intro: WinuxDB is a space for collaboration and helpful technical information. To ensure the quality of our data and the safety of our users, we require all contributors to follow these guidelines.

respect.title: 1. Respect Everyone
respect.content: We have zero tolerance for discrimination, harassment, or hate speech. This includes but is not limited to comments based on gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, religion, or nationality. We are here to talk about software, but we treat people with dignity.

trolls.title: 2. No Trolls or Harassment
trolls.content: Intentional misinformation, inflammatory comments, or personal attacks on other users or developers are strictly prohibited. Harassment includes offensive comments, deliberate intimidation, stalking, following, or unwelcome sexual attention.

integrity.title: 3. Accuracy and Integrity
integrity.content: Report your experiences honestly. Do not submit fake ratings or copy reports from other sources without verification. High-quality technical details (Distro, Kernel, Wine version) are what make WinuxDB valuable.

legal.title: 4. Legal Protection & Disclaimer
legal.content: WinuxDB is a community-driven information resource. The project creator and contributors are not responsible for any system damage, data loss, or legal issues resulting from the use of the information or software linked here. Use compatibility layers and community tweaks at your own risk.

enforcement.title: 5. Enforcement
enforcement.content: Violations of these guidelines may result in the immediate removal of your content and/or a permanent ban from the platform. Moderation is at the sole discretion of the project maintainers.

nativeBanner.title: Native Application
nativeBanner.description: This application has a native Linux version provided directly by the developer. Because it runs without compatibility layers like Wine or Proton, community compatibility reports are not required. Enjoy the best possible performance and stability!

NotFound.title: 404 - App Not Found

wizard.steamGuideStep4: Paste it in the field above.
